p: When constructing SDMs, a strong correlation was observed among some of the 19 bioclimatic variables (Supporting Information Figure S5.6). Three iterations of eliminating variables and factors with low contributions to the total variation were required until all retention criteria were met. Ultimately, four factors (MR1–4, α > 0.7; Supporting Information Figure S3.4) explained 100% of the variation in eight retained variables, and 84% of the variation in all 19 bioclimatic variables. Correlation among the four factors was lower than among the original variables in all four time periods considered (i.e., present, MH, LGM, and LIG; Supporting Information Table S5.6). For convenience, we named the four factors according to the original variables with which they were strongly correlated ( r > 0.9; Supporting Information Figure S5.7; also see Supporting Information Figures S5.8 and S5.9).
